abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings convey a satisfactory
            outcome, highly likely sustainability, and high
            institutional development impacts. Lessons learned highlight
            the importance of counterpart funds, particularly where
            agricultural time-tables relate to impending activities; of
            frequent supervision missions, including flexibility to
            changes and/or adjustments to be made; of effective
            participatory process and decentralized planning for
            projects aimed at improving natural resources management,
            rural poverty alleviation, and income generation; of
            demand-oriented subprojects based on micro-catchments; of
            available sound project management tools to ensure a
            successful performance. Finally, lessons also emphasize the
            need for training technical and administrative staff, and of
            a participatory diagnosis methodology, including specific
            new productive technologies.
